archive.description:
10:48 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for new EBS-backed instance launches and EBS-related APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region.
11:32 PM PDT We continue to investigate increased error rates for new EBS-backed instance launches and EBS-related APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances are unaffected.
11:51 PM PDT Between 9:45 PM and 11:37 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for EBS-backed instance launches and EBS-related APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:29 PM PDT Between 11:25 AM PDT and 11:50 AM PDT we incorrectly displayed the BGP status for virtual interfaces on Direct Connect connections in the US-EAST-1 Region. Despite the status, customers' virtual interfaces were not impaired and continued to send and receive traffic normally. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:17 AM PDT We are investigating increased Notification latencies in the AP-NORTHEAST-2 Region
8:31 AM PDT We have identified the cause for increased Notification latencies in the AP-NORTHEAST-2 Region and continue to work towards resolution. Notification latencies are improving.
9:04 AM PDT We have identified the cause for increased Notification latencies in the AP-NORTHEAST-2 Region and continue to work towards resolution. Notification latencies continue to improve.
9:33 AM PDT Between 7:15 AM and 8:53 AM PDT, we experienced elevated Notification latencies in the AP-NORTHEAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:36 PM PDT We are investigating intermittent connectivity issues to a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region.
4:07 PM PDT We can confirm connectivity issues to some instances in the US-EAST-1 Region. We have identified the root cause and are working to resolve.
5:18 PM PDT We continue to work toward full recovery. For customers that are still seeing impact, you can perform a Stop/Start to resolve the issue. More information on how to Stop/Start your instance can be found here.
5:49 PM PDT Connectivity to most of the affected instances has been restored. We are continuing to work to remediate connectivity to all instances.
6:15 PM PDT We have remediated the connectivity issues that were affecting some instances in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
5:30 PM PDT Between 2:15 PM and 4:30 PM PDT we experienced connectivity issues in the US-EAST-1 Region. The service has recovered and is operating normally.
6:03 AM PDT Between 4:00 AM and 4:42 AM PDT we experienced increased API error rates and latencies in the EU-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:59 PM PDT We are investigating Network Connectivity issues in the US-WEST-2 Region.
2:33 PM PDT Between 1:36 PM and 2:15 PM PDT we experienced network connectivity issues in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:08 PM PDT We are investigating Network Connectivity issues in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
2:25 PM PDT We have identified the root cause of the network connectivity issues in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. We are seeing signs of recovery but continue to work towards fully resolving the issue.
2:32 PM PDT Between 1:36 PM and 2:15 PM PDT we experienced network connectivity issues in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:10 PM PDT We are investigating network connectivity issues affecting Direct Connect customers using the US-WEST-2 Region.
2:37 PM PDT Between 1:36 PM and 2:15 PM PDT we experienced network connectivity issues affecting some Direct Connect locations using the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:14 PM PDT We are investigating network connectivity issues affecting Direct Connect customers using the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
2:35 PM PDT Between 1:36 PM and 2:15 PM PDT we experienced network connectivity issues affecting Direct Connect customers using the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

11:13 AM PDT We're investigating increased error rates for DynamoDB APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region.
11:34 AM PDT Between 10:10 AM and 11:23 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates for DynamoDB APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue is resolved and the service is operating normally.

11:17 AM PDT We are investigating increased Workmail Outlook latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region impacting the sending and receiving of new messages or appointments in Outlook clients.
11:33 AM PDT Between 10:16 AM and 11:07 AM PDT we experienced degraded WorkMail Outlook performances in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.service_name: AWS Identity and Access Management (N. Virginia)
archive.description:
3:40 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latencies for API calls and the IAM Management Console.
3:58 PM PDT Between 3:10 PM and 3:34 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies for API calls and the IAM Management Console. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Degraded automated After Call Work timeout experience
archive.description:
8:57 AM PDT We are investigating degraded experience on automated After Call Work timeout for some agents handling contacts in the US-EAST-1 Region. If an agent is affected, they can flip to Available manually to continue taking contacts as a work around. All other Amazon Connect functionality is working normally.
9:39 AM PDT We continue to investigate degraded experience on automated After Call Work timeout for some agents handling contacts in the US-EAST-1 Region. All other Amazon Connect functionality is working normally.
10:36 AM PDT We have remediated the issue causing a degraded experience in automated After Call Work timeout for some agents in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Delayed Log Event Processing for Metric Filter Extraction and Subscriptions
archive.description:
4:17 PM PDT We are investigating increased delays for CloudWatch log event processing for metric filter extraction and log subscriptions in the US-EAST-1 Region. CloudWatch alarms may transition into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on metrics extracted using log filters.
5:00 PM PDT Between 3:23 PM and 4:48 PM PDT, some customers experienced increased delays for CloudWatch log event processing for metric filter extraction and log subscriptions in the US-EAST-1 Region. Metrics extracted using Logs Filter Patterns were delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on those delayed metrics transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics and log events for subscriptions are in the process of backfilling. The service is operating normally.

7:31 AM PST We are investigating telecom provider connectivity issues in the US-EAST-1 Region affecting calls for some customers.
8:18 AM PST Between 3:49 AM and 7:56 AM PST we experienced telecom provider connectivity issues in the US-EAST-1 Region affecting calls for some customers. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:48 AM PST We are investigating increased error rates for new launches in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region.
7:15 AM PST Between 5:39 AM and 7:02 AM PST we experienced increased error rates for instance launches in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated Faults for CloudWatch Logs APIs
archive.description:
5:43 AM PST We are investigating increased faults for CloudWatch Logs APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. Log events and metrics may be delayed. Alarms may transition into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on delayed metrics.
6:02 AM PST We can confirm increased faults for CloudWatch Logs APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. Log events and metrics are delayed. Alarms may transition into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on delayed metrics. Customers will experience faults in the CloudWatch Logs Management Console.
6:42 AM PST Between 4:00 AM and 6:17 AM PST customers experienced elevated faults when calling CloudWatch Logs APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. Log events and metrics were delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on delayed metrics transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics and log events are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:55 AM PST We are currently experiencing elevated error rates for the CodeBuild APIs and Management Console in the US-EAST-1 Region.
6:15 AM PST We can confirm elevated error rates for the CodeBuild APIs and Management Console in the US-EAST-1 Region.
6:41 AM PST Between 4:44 AM and 6:17 AM PST we experienced elevated error rates for the CodeBuild APIs and Management Console in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated Error Rates in South America
archive.description: 7:50 AM PST Between 6:04 AM and 6:51 AM PST CloudFront end users in South America may have experienced intermittent error rates. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:56 AM PST Between 6:04 AM and 6:51 AM PST customers in South America experienced increased errors for loading the AWS Management Console. The issue has been resolved and the Console is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased Latencies Creating, Updating and Terminating Environments
archive.description:
5:00 AM PST We are investigating increased latencies creating, updating and terminating environments in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1 Region.
5:39 AM PST We continue to investigate increased latencies creating, updating and terminating Elastic Beanstalk environments in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1 Region.
6:03 AM PST Between 4:04 AM and 5:54 AM PST some customers experienced elevated latencies creating, updating and terminating environments in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates and Query Failures
archive.description:
11:16 AM PST We are investigating increased API error rates and query failures in the US-EAST-2 Region.
11:53 AM PST We have identified the root cause of the issue that was causing some customers to see increased API error rates and query failures in the US-EAST-2 Region and we are working towards recovery.
12:08 PM PST Between 9:51 AM and 11:24 AM PST we experienced increased API error rates and query failures in the US-EAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:45 PM PST We are currently investigating increased delivery error rates for our email-sending APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region.
1:53 PM PST We are seeing recovery in delivery rates for our email-sending APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region.
2:39 PM PST Earlier today we experienced elevated delivery failure rates for our email-sending APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:27 PM PST We are investigating connectivity issues for some VPN tunnels in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
4:01 PM PST We continue to work towards resolving the connectivity issue affecting some VPN tunnels in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
4:54 PM PST We continue to work on identifying root cause for the connectivity issues affecting some VPN tunnel in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. VPN tunnels may experience periods of recovery but connectivity is not yet stable. Since not all tunnels are affected by this issue, provisioning a new VPN tunnel may resolve the issue prior to full recovery.
6:26 PM PST We have identified the root cause of the connectivity issue affecting some VPN tunnels in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region and continue to work towards recovery. Since not all tunnels are affected by this issue, provisioning a new VPN tunnel may resolve the issue prior to full recovery.
8:23 PM PST Some of the affected VPN tunnels are seeing periods of recovery as we continue to work towards resolving the connectivity issues affecting some VPN tunnels in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. Since not all tunnels are affected by this issue, provisioning a new VPN tunnel may resolve the issue prior to full recovery.
11:22 PM PST We are seeing recovery for the majority of VPN tunnels experiencing connectivity issues in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
11:31 PM PST We have restored connectivity for all affected VPN tunnels in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:50 AM PST We are investigating connectivity issues for some VPN tunnels in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. We have identified root cause and are working to resolve the issue.
7:01 AM PST We have restored connectivity for some of the affected VPN tunnels and are working towards full recovery.
7:11 AM PST We have restored connectivity for all affected VPN tunnels in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated Latency and API Error Rate
archive.description:
4:49 PM PST We are investigating increased API error rates and latencies for the Amazon EC2 Container Service APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region. Container instance connectivity and running tasks are not affected.
5:38 PM PST We are investigating increased API error rates and latencies for the Amazon EC2 Container Service APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region and continue to work towards resolution. Container instance connectivity and running tasks are not affected.
6:56 PM PST Between 4:02 PM and 5:47 PM PST and also between 6:08 PM and 6:27 PM PST we experienced elevated latency and API error rates for the Amazon EC2 Container Service APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region. Container instance connectivity and running tasks were not affected during this time. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated Latency and API Error Rate
archive.description:
4:57 PM PST We are investigating increased API error rates and latency for the AWS CodeBuild Service APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region.
5:37 PM PST We are investigating increased API error rates and latency for the AWS CodeBuild Service APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region and continue to work towards resolution.
6:56 PM PST Between 4:02 PM and 5:47 PM PST and also between 6:08 PM and 6:27 PM PST we experienced increased error rates for the AWS CodeBuild APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:12 AM PST We are investigating elevated latencies for read and write requests for AWS Storage Gateway in the US-WEST-2 Region.
7:43 AM PST We have identified the cause of elevated latencies for read and write requests for AWS Storage Gateway in the US-WEST-2 Region and continue working towards resolution.
8:22 AM PST Between 6:18 AM and 8:06 AM PST we experienced elevated latencies for read and write requests for AWS Storage Gateway in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

9:48 AM PST We are investigating increased error rates in domain validations. Customers are experiencing an error when attempting to approve certificate issuance on the validation website using email validation. Certificates requested using DNS validation are being delayed.
10:28 AM PST We can confirm customers are experiencing an error when attempting to validate a domain using email validation for certificate requests and renewals. This is preventing issuance of these certificates. Operations using existing certificates, including binding and unbinding certificates, are not impacted. Certificates requested using DNS validation are being delayed.
12:33 PM PST Between 7:56 AM and 11:26 AM PST customers were experiencing errors when attempting to validate a domain. Operations with existing certificates were not impacted. Binding and unbinding of certificates with AWS services were not impacted. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:30 PM PST We are investigating increased error rates latencies for stack creation, deletion, and updates in the US-EAST-1 Region.
2:32 PM PST We can confirm increased error rates and latencies for creating and deleting stacks in the US-EAST-1 Region and continue to work towards resolution.
3:49 PM PST New stack operations are progressing successfully and we are in the process of unblocking pending update and delete operations for existing stacks in the US-EAST-1 Region.
5:31 PM PST We continue to unblock the remaining stacks that are pending their update or delete operations in the US-EAST-1 Region. CloudFormation operations for new stacks are working normally.
6:35 PM PST Between 12:35 PM and 6:20 PM PST we experienced increased latencies for stack creation, deletion, and updates in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Delays in Launching and Terminating Clusters
archive.description:
1:52 PM PST We are investigating delays in launching and terminating clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region.
2:40 PM PST We can confirm delays in launching and terminating clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region and continue to work towards resolution.
4:28 PM PST We can confirm delays in launching and terminating clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region. Submission of jobs to existing clusters is not impacted. We continue to work towards resolution.
6:46 PM PST Between 12:40 PM and 6:30 PM PST we experienced delays in starting and terminating clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated API Faults and Alarm Delays
archive.description:
5:07 AM PST We are investigating increased faults for CloudWatch alarms APIs and delays in processing some alarms in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
5:39 AM PST We continue to investigate increased faults for CloudWatch alarms APIs and delays in processing some alarms in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
6:21 AM PST We have identified the cause of increased faults for CloudWatch alarms APIs and delays in processing some alarms in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region and continue to work towards resolution.
7:02 AM PST We have remediated the increased faults for CloudWatch alarms APIs and delays in processing some alarms in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:32 PM PST We are investigating increased error rates for some Application Load Balancers in the US-EAST-1 Region.
2:45 PM PST Between 1:53 PM and 2:29 PM PST, we experienced connectivity issues for Web Application Firewall enabled Application Load Balancers in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated error rates for Route 53 Management Console
archive.description:
8:13 PM PST We are currently experiencing elevated error rates for the Route 53 Management Console. API and DNS queries are all being answered normally.
8:53 PM PST We have identified the root cause for the elevated error rates on the Route 53 Management Console and are starting to see recovery. Route 53 API calls and DNS resolution continue to operate normally.
9:04 PM PST Between 7:49 PM and 8:45 PM PST the Route 53 Management Console was experiencing elevated error rates. The issue has been resolved and the Route 53 Management Console is now operating normally. During this entire time period the Route 53 API and DNS resolution continued to function normally.

5:48 AM PST We are investigating increased error rates and latencies for the AWS Management Console in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
6:06 AM PST Between 5:03 AM and 5:53 AM PST we experienced increased error rates and latencies for the AWS Management Console in the EU-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:48 PM PST We are investigating increased DB instance creation times in the US-WEST-2 Region.
6:39 PM PST We have identified the problem with increased DB instance creation times in the US-WEST-2 Region and are working towards a resolution.
7:31 PM PST Between 3:20 PM and 7:05 PM PST, we experienced increased DB instance creation times in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:47 PM PST We are investigating increased WorkMail SMTP E-Mail processing time in the US-EAST-1 Region resulting in a delay of received or sent email to client applications.
1:48 PM PST We are continuing to investigate increased WorkMail SMTP E-Mail processing time in the US-EAST-1 Region, resulting in a delay of received or sent email to client applications.
2:29 PM PST Between 10:45 AM and 2:10 PM PST we experienced increased WorkMail SMTP E-Mail processing time in the US-EAST-1 Region, resulting in a delay of received or sent email to client applications. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
8:49 AM PST Between 7:41 AM and 8:04 AM PST we experienced increased API error rates in the AP-SOUTH-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:30 PM PST We are investigating increased error rates for Autoscaling API calls in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
12:56 PM PST  Between 11:43 AM and 12:48 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for Autoscaling API calls in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
5:39 PM PST Between 4:03 PM and 4:57 PM PST we experienced increased API error rates and latencies in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated Console and API Error Rates
archive.description: 2:57 AM PST Between 1:31 AM and 2:18 AM PST, we experienced elevated error rates for the CloudFront Management Console and API calls to manage distribution configurations and invalidations. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

10:21 AM PST We are investigating increased error rates for new launches of C5 and M5 instance types in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-2 Region.
10:47 AM PST We can confirm increased error rates for new launches of C5 and M5 instance types in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-2 Region. We have identified the root cause and are working toward full resolution. In the interim, we recommend customers launch their instances to an alternate Availability Zone.
11:30 AM PST We have resolved the issue affecting new launches of C5 and M5 instance types in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-2 Region. Existing instances were not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:08 PM PST Between 2:41 PM and 2:56 PM PST some EC2 instances experienced elevated DNS resolution errors in the EU-WEST-1 Region. As a result of this, some AWS services experienced elevated errors and increased latency. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:12 PM PST Between 2:41 PM and 2:56 PM PST some EC2 instances experienced elevated DNS resolution errors in the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region. As a result of this, some AWS services experienced elevated errors and increased latency. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:29 AM PST We are investigating increased packet loss possibly impacting some AWS Direct Connect customers in the US-EAST-1 Region.
8:03 AM PST We continue to work towards resolving the increased packet loss impacting AWS Direct Connect connectivity to the US-EAST-1 Region. Direct Connect connections from the Equinix DC1 - DC6 and DC10 - DC12, Ashburn, VA and CoreSite VA1 and VA2, Reston, VA locations are affected by this issue.
9:43 AM PST Connections in the CoreSite VA1 and VA2 (Reston, VA) location, and some connections in the Equinix DC1 - DC6 and DC10 - DC12 (Ashburn, VA) location are inactive. Inactive connections are not receiving routes advertised from Direct Connect routers. We are now working to restore service on these Direct Connect connections. The AWS VPN service is operating normally and may be an alternative for some workloads.
11:21 AM PST Between 6:23 AM and 10:26 AM PST on March 2, 2018, some customers in the CoreSite VA1 and VA2 (Reston, VA) Direct Connect location and the Equinix DC1 - DC6 and DC10 - DC12 (Ashburn, VA) Direct Connect location experienced a connection loss to the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

10:24 AM PST Between 6:23 AM and 6:32 AM PST and between 8:11 AM and 8:21 AM PST, customers in the US-EAST-1 Region may have experienced Internet connectivity issues. The root cause of this issue was a loss of power in one of our network peering facilities. Our network is designed to be fully redundant with multiple independent peering facilities in every region. Some customers experienced elevated latency and packet loss while the network rerouted affected traffic to these unaffected network peering facilities. Some packet loss was also observed as we restored traffic to the affected network peering facility. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:55 PM PST We are investigating increased push notification latency in the US-EAST-1 Region. This is affecting meeting rings as well as chat notifications.
4:04 PM PST We have identified the root cause of increased push chat notification and meeting ring latency in the US-EAST-1 Region and continue to work toward resolution.
5:10 PM PST Between 1:10 PM and 5:02 PM PST we experienced increased latencies for push chat notification and meeting rings in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates and Latencies
archive.description:
2:39 AM PDT We are investigating increased API error rates and latencies for Instance and AMI related API calls in the US-EAST-1 Region.
3:31 AM PDT Between March 12 9:00 PM and March 13 2:21 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies for Instance and AMI related API calls in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing running instances were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:20 PM PDT We are investigating intermittent DNS resolution issues in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region.
2:36 PM PDT Between 1:41 PM and 2:30 PM PDT we experienced intermittent DNS resolution issues in a single Availability Zone in the SA-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased Error Rates for requests to Amazon S3
archive.description:
6:55 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for requests made to Amazon S3 in the US-EAST-1 Region.
7:19 AM PDT  Between 5:56 AM and 6:08 AM PDT, customers in the US-EAST-1 Region experienced an increased error rate on requests made to Amazon S3. After that initial impact, customers may have continued to experience a slightly elevated error rate and latencies until 7:02 AM PDT. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
8:30 AM PDT After seeing recovery from the event that occurred earlier today, we've seen another increase in error rates on requests made to Amazon S3 in the US-EAST-1 Region.
9:10 AM PDT We can confirm that the elevated rate of errors in Amazon S3 are for requests made to the VPC Endpoint. The Amazon S3 regional endpoint for the US-EAST-1 Region is operating normally.
9:52 AM PDT We have resolved the issue causing increased error rates and timeouts for requests made via Amazon VPC Endpoints to Amazon S3 in the US-EAST-1 Region. Traffic to Amazon S3 via the public endpoints was not affected by this issue. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] VPC Endpoints Error Rates and Timeouts
archive.description:
9:02 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and timeouts for requests made via Amazon VPC Endpoints to Amazon S3 or Amazon DynamoDB in the US-EAST-1 Region. We are working on resolving the issue, and while the initial impact has been mitigated, we continue to experience periods of increased error rates and timeouts via Amazon VPC Endpoints. Traffic to Amazon S3 and Amazon DynamoDB via the public endpoints is not affected.
9:50 AM PDT Between 5:57 AM and 7:02 AM PDT and between 8:07 AM and 9:12 AM PDT, we experienced intermittent periods of increased error rates and timeouts for requests made via Amazon VPC Endpoints to Amazon S3 and Amazon DynamoDB in the US-EAST-1 Region. Traffic to Amazon S3 and Amazon DynamoDB via the public endpoints, and all other Amazon VPC functionality was not affected by this issue. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

9:07 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for all API calls in the US-EAST-1 Region.
9:41 AM PDT Between 8:43 AM and 9:26 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates for API calls in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

10:07 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for all APIs calls in the US-EAST-1 Region.
10:36 AM PDT Between 9:42 AM and 10:30 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates for API calls in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

10:19 AM PDT We are currently investigating increased error rates to Elastic Beanstalk APIs in the US-EAST-1 region.
10:38 AM PDT Between 9:42 AM and 10:30 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates to Elastic Beanstalk APIs in the US-EAST-1 region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:36 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for new launches in the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region.
6:07 AM PDT Between 05:00 AM PDT and 05:37 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates for instance launches in the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region. Existing instances were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:02 PM PDT We are investigating increased faults for CloudWatch Logs APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region. Log events and metrics may be delayed. Alarms may transition into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on delayed metrics.
7:43 PM PDT We can confirm increased faults for CloudWatch Logs APIs and some delayed log events in the US-WEST-2 Region. We are actively working to resolve the issue.
10:09 PM PDT We can confirm partial recovery of API faults and reduced delay of log events in the US-WEST-2 Region. We have identified the root cause and are actively working to resolve the issue.
10:45 PM PDT  Between 5:56 PM and 10:15 PM PDT, some customers experienced increased delays for CloudWatch log events in the US-WEST-2 Region. Metrics filtered from those log events were delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on delayed metrics may have transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates and Latencies
archive.description:
7:41 PM PDT We are investigating elevated PutRecord API latencies and faults for Kinesis Data Streams in the US-WEST-2 Region.
8:19 PM PDT We can confirm elevated latencies and faults for Kinesis Data Streams PutRecord API in the US-WEST-2 Region. We are actively working to resolve the issue.
10:12 PM PDT We can confirm partial recovery of faults for Kinesis Data Streams PutRecord API in the US-WEST-2 Region. We have identified the root cause and are actively working to resolve the issue.
10:42 PM PDT Between 5:56 PM and 10:15 PM PDT we experienced increased API latencies and error rates in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:54 AM PDT We are investigating errors and latencies on IAM Console and APIs in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. Users may experience delays or failures in the creation or modification of IAM entities such as users, roles and policies. Authentication and authorizations using existing IAM entities are not impacted.
7:29 AM PDT Between 5:08 AM and 7:15 AM PDT we experienced increased errors and latencies on IAM Console and APIs in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:20 AM PDT We are investigating increased provisioning and back-end instance registration times for Classic and Application Load Balancers in the US-EAST-1 Region. Provisioning and back-end registration times for Network Load Balancers are not affected. Connectivity to all existing load balancers is not affected.
3:57 AM PDT We have identified the root cause of the issue affecting Classic and Application Load Balancers in the US-EAST-1 Region. The subsystem responsible for the provisioning and registration of back-end instances and targets is experiencing delays in workflow processing and we're working to resolve the issue. Provisioning and back-end instance registration times for Network Load Balancers are not affected. Connectivity to all existing load balancers is not affected.
4:22 AM PDT We have resolved the issue affecting Classic and Application Load Balancers in the US-EAST-1 Region. The subsystem responsible for the provisioning and registration of back-end instances is now operating normally but is working through a backlog of load balancer events for affected load balancers. Provisioning and back-end instance registration times for Network Load Balancers are not affected. Connectivity to all existing load balancers is not affected.
4:48 AM PDT Between 2:19 AM and 4:15 AM PDT we experienced increased provisioning and back-end instance registration times for Classic and Application Load Balancers in the US-EAST-1 Region. Provisioning and back-end instance registration times for Network Load Balancers were not affected. Connectivity to all existing load balancers was not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:03 PM PDT We are investigating increased query failures in the US-EAST-1 Region.
12:50 PM PDT We can confirm customers are seeing an increase in stuck or failed queries in the US-EAST-1 Region. We have identified the root cause and continue to work toward resolution.
1:33 PM PDT We are starting to see recovery and customers will see some queries completing successfully. As we recover, customers may see transient errors. We continue to work towards a complete recovery.
1:51 PM PDT We are seeing a significant reduction in error rates and most customers should see their queries completing successfully. We are continuing to work towards a complete recovery.
2:07 PM PDT Between 11:36 AM and 1:50 PM PDT we experienced increased query failures in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Investigating reports of DNS Resolution Issues
archive.description:
5:19 AM PDT We are investigating reports of problems resolving some DNS records hosted on Route53 using the third party DNS resolvers 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4 . DNS resolution using other third-party DNS resolvers or DNS resolution from within EC2 instances using the default EC2 resolvers are not affected at this time.
5:49 AM PDT We have identified the cause for an elevation in DNS resolution errors using third party DNS resolvers 8.8.8.8 / 8.8.4.4 and are working towards resolution. DNS resolution using other third-party DNS resolvers or DNS resolution from within EC2 instances using the default EC2 resolvers continues to work normally.
6:10 AM PDT Between 4:05 AM PDT and 5:56 AM PDT, some customers may have experienced elevated errors resolving DNS records hosted on Route 53 using DNS resolvers 8.8.8.8 / 8.8.4.4. This issue was caused by a problem with a third-party Internet provider. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:30 PM PDT Between 4:51 PM and 5:09 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:25 AM PDT Between 5:13 AM and 5:53 AM PDT we experienced an Internet connectivity issue with an external provider outside of our network which affected traffic from some end-user networks and the SA-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity to instances and services within the Region was not impacted by the event. The issue has been resolved and connectivity has been restored.

9:13 PM PDT We are investigating increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region.
9:51 PM PDT Between 8:35 PM and 9:32 PM PDT we experienced increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

10:08 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latency in creating new IAM roles in the US-EAST-1 Region and we continue working towards resolution. Previously created roles are not impacted.
11:08 PM PDT We are continuing to investigate increased error rates and latency in creating new IAM roles in the US-EAST-1 Region and we continue working towards resolution. Previously created roles are not impacted.
12:10 AM PDT IAM API calls have recovered and latency for IAM mutating changes is currently reducing in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue working towards complete resolution. Previously created roles are not impacted.
12:39 AM PDT Between May 3 4:41 PM PDT and May 4 12:19 AM PDT, IAM experienced increased error rates and latency in creating or updating IAM roles and principals. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

11:21 PM PDT We are investigating increased latency for the creation of Redshift clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing clusters are not impacted.
12:48 AM PDT Between May 3 4:41 PM PDT and May 4 12:40 AM PDT, Redshift experienced increased latency in creating and restoring Redshift Clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:50 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latency in creating new IAM roles in the US-EAST-1 Region and we continue working towards resolution. Previously created roles are not impacted.
9:27 AM PDT Between 7:19 AM and 8:20 AM PDT, we experienced elevated error rates and latencies creating or accessing IAM entities and authenticating against newly created entities. AWS Services that make use of new IAM users and roles may have been affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:06 PM PDT We are investigating increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region.
6:26 PM PDT We are continuing to investigate increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region
7:24 PM PDT We have identified the root cause of the elevated API error rates and can confirm that most customers have recovered. We are continuing to work towards full resolution.
7:40 PM PDT Between 5:42 PM and 7:04 PM PDT, we experienced increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:12 AM PDT We are investigating delayed network provisioning for newly launched instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region.
8:45 AM PDT Between 5:27 AM and 8:17 AM PDT we experienced delayed network provisioning for newly launched instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue have been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:14 AM PDT We are investigating increased provisioning times for load balancers in the US-EAST-1 Region. Registration of back-end instances and connectivity to existing instances are not affected.
8:53 AM PDT Between 6:05 AM and 8:17 AM PDT we experienced delayed network provisioning for newly launched instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. Registration of back-end instances and connectivity to existing instances are not affected. The issue have been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:19 AM PDT We are investigating delays in starting Amazon EMR clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing clusters are not impacted.
8:40 AM PDT Between 7:00 AM and 8:15 AM PDT we experienced delays in starting Amazon EMR clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing clusters were not impacted. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
3:32 AM PDT Between 2:35 AM and 2:39 AM PDT, we experienced elevated error rates for requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:13 AM PDT We are investigating increased Build error rates in US-EAST-1 Region.
5:12 AM PDT Between 2:50 AM and 4:55 AM PDT, we experienced elevated Build error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:15 AM PDT We are currently investigating increased error rates in provisioning streaming instances in the US-EAST-1 Region.
5:22 AM PDT Between 2:50 AM and 5:06 AM PDT, we experienced increased error rates in provisioning streaming instances. The issue has been resolved now and the service is operating normally.
5:18 AM PDT Between 2:50 AM and 4:55 AM PDT we experienced increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:09 AM PDT We are investigating connectivity issues for some instances in the SA-EAST-1 Region.
8:32 AM PDT  Between 7:26 AM and 7:34 AM PDT, and between 7:57 AM to 8:05 AM PDT, some instances experienced connectivity issues in the SA-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased Outlook Sync Latencies and Errors
archive.description:
12:13 PM PDT We are investigating increased WorkMail Outlook synchronization latencies and error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region impacting the sending and receiving of new messages or appointments in Outlook clients.
12:30 PM PDT Between 11:06 AM and 12:09 PM PDT we experienced increased WorkMail Outlook synchronization latencies and error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region, impacting the sending and receiving of new messages or appointments in Outlook clients. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:31 PM PDT We are investigating reports that some users are unable to sign in or sign up to applications using Facebook identities with Amazon Cognito User Pools.
8:17 PM PDT Recently, some users were unable to sign in or sign up to applications using Facebook identities with Amazon Cognito User Pools. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:36 AM PDT We are currently investigating connectivity issues in the US-EAST-2 Region.
1:01 AM PDT Between 12:11 AM and 12:45 AM PDT we experienced impaired Internet connectivity in the US-EAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:49 AM PDT  We are currently investigating connectivity issues in the US-EAST-2 Region.
12:59 AM PDT Between 12:11 AM and 12:45 AM PDT we experienced impaired Internet connectivity in the US-EAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:03 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for file system requests in the US-WEST-2 Region.
2:58 PM PDT Between 1:00 PM and 2:29 PM PDT, we experienced increased error rates for file system read/write requests in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:13 PM PDT We are investigating connectivity issues affecting some instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region.
3:42 PM PDT We can confirm that there has been an issue in one of the datacenters that makes up one of US-EAST-1 Availability Zones. This was a result of a power event impacting a small percentage of the physical servers in that datacenter as well as some of the networking devices. Customers with EC2 instances in this availability zone may see issues with connectivity to the affected instances. We are seeing recovery and continue to work toward full resolution.
4:29 PM PDT We have restored power to the vast majority of the affected instances and continue to work towards full recovery.
5:36 PM PDT ﻿﻿Beginning at 2:52 PM PDT a small percentage of EC2 servers lost power in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. This resulted in some impaired EC2 instances and degraded performance for some EBS volumes in the affected Availability Zone. Power was restored at 3:22 PM PDT, at which point the vast majority of instances and volumes saw recovery. We have been working to recover the remaining instances and volumes. The small number of remaining instances and volumes are hosted on hardware which was adversely affected by the loss of power. While we will continue to work to recover all affected instances and volumes, for immediate recovery, we recommend replacing any remaining affected instances or volumes if possible.

3:43 PM PDT We are investigating connectivity issues affecting some Redshift clusters in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region.
4:07 PM PDT Between 2:52 PM and 3:55 PM PDT we experienced connectivity issues affecting some clusters in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:49 PM PDT We are investigating elevated error rates for connections to some WorkSpaces in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region.
4:18 PM PDT Between 2:52 PM and 4:15 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for connections to some WorkSpaces in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:58 PM PDT We are investigating connectivity issues affecting some database instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region.
4:12 PM PDT Beginning at 2:52 PM PDT, we experienced connectivity issues affecting some database instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. Multi-AZ database instances functioned correctly and remain available. A small number of Single-AZ database instances remain unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue.
5:42 PM PDT Beginning at 2:52 PM PDT, we experienced connectivity issues affecting some database instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. Multi-AZ database instances functioned correctly and remained available. Connectivity was restored at 3:22 PM PDT, at which point the vast majority of database instances recovered. A small number of Single-AZ database instances remain unavailable and we are continuing to work to recover all affected database instances.

6:17 AM PDT We are investigating increased propagation times of DNS edits to the Route 53 DNS servers. This does not impact queries to existing DNS records.
6:47 AM PDT Between 5:42 AM and 6:45 AM PDT, we experienced increased propagation times of DNS edits to the Route 53 DNS servers. This did not impact queries to existing DNS records. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:22 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for API calls in the US-EAST-1 Region.
5:33 PM PDT Between 5:05 PM and 5:26 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for API calls in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Delays in propagating certain configuration changes to a few CloudFront Edge locations
archive.description:
6:16 AM PDT We are investigating longer than usual propagation times to propagate certain configuration changes to a few of our edge locations: the creation and deletion of CloudFront distributions and the updating of certificates for a CloudFront distribution. All other CloudFront configuration changes are propagating normally. End-user requests for content from our edge locations are not affected by this issue and are being served normally.
6:59 AM PDT Between 3:25 AM and 6:45 AM PDT, CloudFront experienced longer than usual propagation times to propagate certain configuration changes to a few of our edge locations. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally. During this time, end user requests for content from our edge locations were not affected by this issue and were being served normally.

9:39 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latencies for ELB APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. Traffic to existing load balancers is not affected.
10:11 AM PDT Between 8:59 AM and 9:58 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies for the ELB APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue affected load balancer provisioning and target registration for Application and Network Load Balancer. Classic Load Balancer, as well as traffic to all existing load balancers, was not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

11:46 AM PDT We are investigating elevated error rates for APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region.
12:31 PM PDT Between 11:11 AM and 12:00 PM PDT we experienced elevated error rates for APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:30 PM PDT Between 11:01 AM and 11:20 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates in creating and accessing Cloud9 environments in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:16 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latencies for the IAM APIs.
4:24 PM PDT Between 3:38 PM and 4:11 PM PDT we experienced increased IAM API error rates and latencies. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
7:08 PM PDT Between 5:14 PM and 6:09 PM PDT, we experienced increased error rates for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is now operating normally.

11:20 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for connections to AWS IoT Core, affecting some customers in the US-EAST-1 Region.
11:38 AM PDT We continue to investigate increased error rates for connections to AWS IoT Core, affecting some customers in the US-EAST-1 Region.
12:02 PM PDT Error rates for connections to AWS IoT Core in the US-EAST-1 Region are improving. We continue to work towards full resolution.
12:44 PM PDT Between 9:26 AM and 11:56 AM PDT we experienced intermittent elevated error rates for connections to AWS IoT Core in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

11:02 AM PDT We are investigating meeting availability issues in the US-EAST-1 Region.
11:18 AM PDT We continue to investigate meeting availability issues in the US-EAST-1 Region.
11:49 AM PDT Between 10:24 AM PDT and 11:31 AM PDT, we experienced meeting availability issues in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:44 AM PDT We are investigating increased propagation times of DNS edits to the Route 53 DNS servers. This does not impact queries to existing DNS records.
5:15 AM PDT We can confirm increased propagation times of DNS edits to the Route 53 DNS servers and continue to work towards resolution. This does not impact queries to existing DNS records.
6:02 AM PDT Propagation of DNS edits for Route 53 records in Public Hosted Zones has recovered. We are still working towards recovery for DNS edits for records in Route 53 Private Hosted Zones.
6:24 AM PDT Between 4:00 AM and 6:14 AM PDT we experienced increased propagation times of DNS edits to a single Route 53 edge location. This does not impact queries to existing DNS records. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:51 PM PDT We are currently experiencing intermittent errors accessing the AWS Management Console. AWS services are operating normally.
2:10 PM PDT We are currently experiencing intermittent errors accessing the AWS Management Console when using root account login credentials. The underlying AWS services and console logins using IAM users are operating normally.
2:47 PM PDT We have identified the root cause for the intermittent errors accessing the AWS Management Console when using root account login credentials. We are beginning to see recovery, and continue to work toward full resolution. The underlying AWS services and console logins using IAM users continue to operate normally.
3:44 PM PDT Between 12:28 PM and 3:13 PM PDT we experienced intermittent errors accessing the AWS Management Console. AWS services were not affected by this event. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:14 PM PDT We are investigating connectivity issues to a single Availability Zone in the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region.
6:34 PM PDT Between 5:39 PM and 5:49 PM PDT we experienced network connectivity issues for some instances in a single Availability Zone in the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [解決済み]SQSでのコネクションリセット及びソケットタイムアウトの発生 | [RESOLVED] Connection reset and socket timeout for SQS
archive.description:
4:12 AM PDT 日本時間 2018/08/02 17:30 から 17:55 にかけて、東京リージョンの SQS においてコネクションリセット及びソケットタイムアウトの発生率が上昇しました。問題は既に解消し、現在サービスは正常に稼働しております。| Between 1:30AM and 1:55 AM PDT we experienced connection resets and socket timeout rates in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
4:22 AM PDT 日本時間 2018/08/02 17:30 から 17:55 にかけて、東京リージョンの SQS においてコネクションリセット及びソケットタイムアウトの発生率が上昇しました。問題は既に解消し、現在サービスは正常に稼働しております。| Between 1:30AM and 1:55 AM PDT we experienced connection resets and socket timeout rates in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED]  Increased Console and API error rates
archive.description: 1:47 AM PDT Between 12:49 AM and 1:04 AM PDT customers using the Route 53 console and API experienced an elevated error rate. The issue has been resolved and both the Route 53 console and API are operating normally. Route 53 DNS and health checks were both operating normally during this time.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Instance launch errors and connectivity issues
archive.description: 1:49 PM PDT Between 1:06 PM and 1:33 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for new instance launches and intermittent network connectivity issues for some running instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] SNSのエラーレート上昇について | Elevated error rates for SNS
archive.description:
7:31 PM PDT 東京リージョンにおきまして、現在SNS Publish APIのエラーレートが上昇しており、原因を調査しております。| We are currently investigating elevated error rates for the SNS Publish API in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region.
8:34 PM PDT 東京リージョンにおきまして、日本時間 2018年8月8日 10:47-12:08の間、SNS Publish APIのエラーレートが上昇しておりました。事象は復旧し、サービスは正常に稼働しております。| Between 6:47 PM and 8:08 PM PDT we experienced elevated error rates for the SNS Publish API in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] エラーレートの上昇について | Elevated Error Rates
archive.description:
7:50 PM PDT 東京リージョンにおきまして、AWS マネジメントコンソールのエラーレートが上昇しており、原因を調査しております。| We are investigating elevated error rates for the AWS Management Console in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region.
8:26 PM PDT 東京リージョンにおきまして、日本時間 2018年8月8日 10:47-12:08にかけて AWS マネージメントコンソールのエラーレートが上昇しておりました。事象は復旧し、コンソールは正常に稼働しております。| Between 6:47 PM and 8:08 PM PDT, users experienced elevated error rates for the AWS Management Console in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the Console is operating normally.

3:02 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates impacting start up of clusters operations in the AP-SOUTH-1 Region.
4:13 AM PDT Between 5:10 PM on August 7th, and 3:50 AM PDT on August 8th, we experienced increased error rates in starting clusters in the AP-SOUTH-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:05 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates impacting start up of clusters operations in the EU-WEST-3 Region.
4:16 AM PDT Between 5:10 PM on August 7th, and 3:50 AM PDT on August 8th, we experienced increased error rates in starting clusters in the EU-WEST-3 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:07 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates impacting start up of clusters operations in the US-EAST-2 Region.
4:18 AM PDT Between 5:10 PM on August 7th, and 3:50 AM PDT on August 8th, we experienced increased error rates in starting clusters in the US-EAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:09 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates impacting start up of clusters operations in the US-EAST-1 Region.
4:19 AM PDT Between 5:10 PM on August 7th, and 3:50 AM PDT on August 8th, we experienced increased error rates in starting clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:12 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates impacting start up of clusters operations in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
4:21 AM PDT Between 5:10 PM on August 7th, and 3:50 AM PDT on August 8th, we experienced increased error rates in starting clusters in the EU-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:14 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates impacting start up of clusters operations in the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region
4:23 AM PDT Between 5:10 PM on August 7th, and 3:50 AM PDT on August 8th, we experienced increased error rates in starting clusters in the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:16 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates impacting start up of clusters operations in the US-WEST-1 Region.
4:26 AM PDT Between 5:10 PM on August 7th, and 3:50 AM PDT on August 8th, we experienced increased error rates in starting clusters in the US-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:18 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates impacting start up of clusters operations in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1 Region.
4:29 AM PDT Between 5:10 PM on August 7th, and 3:50 AM PDT on August 8th, we experienced increased error rates in starting clusters in the AP-SOUTHEAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:23 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates impacting start up of clusters operations in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region.
4:31 AM PDT Between 5:10 PM on August 7th, and 3:50 AM PDT on August 8th, we experienced increased error rates in starting clusters in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

9:28 AM PDT We are investigating increased deployment latencies in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
9:59 AM PDT Between 7:27 AM and 9:56 AM PDT we experienced increased deployment latencies in the EU-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:15 PM PDT We can confirm increased error rates and latencies for the SSO service in the US-EAST-1 Region and continue to work towards resolution.
2:39 PM PDT Between 10:30 AM and 2:18 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies for the SSO service in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:47 AM PDT We are investigating degraded call quality in the US-EAST-1 Region.
9:21 AM PDT Between 7:10 AM and 8:55 AM PDT, we experienced degraded call quality in the US-EAST-1 Region. Agents and end-customers may have experienced increased call latency or static on calls during this time. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:49 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for API calls for Cognito User Pools in the US-WEST-2 Region.
1:16 PM PDT We can confirm increased error rates for API calls for Cognito User Pools in the US-WEST-2 Region and continue to work towards resolution.
1:34 PM PDT Between 11:33 AM and 1:25 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for API calls for Cognito User Pools in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

9:13 AM PDT We are currently investigating elevated error rates for SQS in the US-EAST-1 Region.
9:30 AM PDT Between 7:38 AM and 9:18 AM PDT, we experienced elevated API error rates and connection failures in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

9:08 PM PDT We are investigating degraded WorkMail service performance in the US-EAST-1 Region, impacting IMAP client usability and synchronization of messages. There is no impact to Outlook, EWS client applications or mobile clients.
9:40 PM PDT We have identified the cause of degraded WorkMail service performance in the US-EAST-1 Region, impacting IMAP client usability and synchronization of messages and continue working towards resolution. There is no impact to Outlook, EWS client applications or mobile clients.
9:59 PM PDT Between 7:10 PM and 9:46 PM PDT we experienced degraded WorkMail service performance in the US-EAST-1 Region, impacting IMAP client usability and synchronization of messages. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:06 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for new launches in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
1:37 AM PDT We can confirm increased API error rates and connectivity issues for some instances in a single Availability Zone in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
2:14 AM PDT We continue to investigate connectivity issues from some instances to some AWS services in the EU-WEST-1 Region. We have identified the root cause and are taking steps to resolve the issue.
3:03 AM PDT We have resolved the connectivity issues from EC2 instances to the affected AWS services in the EU-WEST-1 Region. We continue to see elevated error rates for the RunInstances EC2 API, which we are working to resolve. Internet connectivity and connectivity between EC2 instances remain unaffected.
3:28 AM PDT Starting at 12:15 AM PDT we experienced increased API error rates for the EC2 API, and connectivity issues between EC2 instances and AWS services in the EU-WEST-1 Region. At 2:29 AM PDT, the connectivity issues between EC2 instances and AWS services were resolved. At 2:59 AM PDT, the increased API error rates for the EC2 APIs were fully resolved. Internet connectivity and connectivity between EC2 instances was not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:11 AM PDT We are continuing to investigate connectivity issues impacting CloudHSM and CloudHSM Classic HSMs in a single Availability Zone in EU-WEST-1 Region.
3:44 AM PDT We can confirm that current generation CloudHSM instances are operating normally. CloudHSM Classic instances in a single Availability Zone in the EU-WEST-1 Region are experiencing network connectivity errors. As we work to recover the remaining CloudHSM Classic instances, we will continue to provide updates via the Personal Health Dashboard.
4:13 AM PDT Between 12:15 AM and 2:12 AM PDT, we experienced increased error rates for console requests in EU-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is now operating normally.

4:19 AM PDT Between 12:15 AM and 2:29 AM PDT, we experienced increased packet loss, impacting AWS Direct Connect connectivity for some customers in the EU-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is now operating normally.
6:23 PM PDT Between 5:45 PM and 6:10 PM PDT we experienced increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

10:12 AM PDT We are investigating intermittent connectivity issues between the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region and other AWS Regions.
10:24 AM PDT We can confirm intermittent issues for Internet and Inter-region network connectivity within the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region. We have mitigated the impact but continue to work towards full resolution.
10:59 AM PDT Between 9:21 AM and 9:31 AM PDT and between 9:41 AM and 9:51 AM PDT we experienced Internet connectivity issues for the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region and Inter-region connectivity issues between the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region and other AWS regions. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:12 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region.
2:06 PM PDT We continue to investigate increased error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs and EC2 Management Console in the US-WEST-2 Region. Existing EC2 instances are not affected.
3:14 PM PDT We are seeing recovery for the increased error rates and latencies affecting the EC2 APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region. Some requests may return a "request limit exceeded" error as we work toward full recovery. We recommend retrying failed requests.
4:41 PM PDT Error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region remain at normal levels. A small percentage of requests are still returning a "request limit exceeded" error as we work toward full recovery. We recommend retrying failed requests.
5:33 PM PDT Starting at 11:20 AM PDT, we experienced periods of increased error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region. At 2:02 PM PDT, error rates and latencies recovered for the majority of the affected APIs. At 2:55 PM PDT error rates and latencies returned to normal levels but some customers continued to experience "request limit exceeded" errors. At 5:10 PM PDT, all error rates, including "request limit exceeded" errors, returned to normal levels. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:09 PM PDT We are investigating increased launch times for EC2 instances managed by Auto Scaling in the US-WEST-2 Region.
3:29 PM PDT Between 12:32 PM PDT and 2:40 PM PDT, we experienced elevated launch times for EC2 instance managed by Auto Scaling in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:12 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for newly created functions in the US-WEST-2 Region. This includes functions created via the console as well as those created via the API or CLI.
3:51 PM PDT We continue to investigate increased error rates for newly created VPC functions in the US-WEST-2 Region. This includes VPC functions created via the console as well as those created via the API or CLI. The issue has been resolved for non-VPC functions.
5:14 PM PDT Between 12:47 PM PDT and 4:55 PM PDT, we experienced increased error rates for newly created functions in US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:14 PM PDT We are investigating increased provisioning times for load balancers in the US-WEST-2 Region. Connectivity to existing load balancers is not affected.
3:49 PM PDT We are seeing an improvement in the increased provisioning times affecting load balancers in the US-WEST-2 Region. We continue to work towards full recovery.
5:25 PM PDT Between 1:00 PM and 4:48 PM PDT, we experienced increased provisioning times for load balancers in the US-WEST-2 Region. Connectivity to load balancers was not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:26 PM PDT We are investigating delays in starting clusters in the US-WEST-2 Region. Existing clusters are not affected.
3:53 PM PDT We continue to investigate delays in starting clusters in the US-WEST-2 Region. Existing clusters are not affected.
5:11 PM PDT Between 1:10 PM and 4:20 PM PDT we experienced delays in starting clusters in US-West-2 Region. Existing clusters were not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
5:17 PM PDT Between 1:10 PM and 4:20 PM PDT we experienced delays in starting clusters in US-WEST-2 Region. Existing clusters were not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:56 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latencies for provisioning new WorkSpaces in the US-WEST-2 Region
3:21 PM PDT Between 1:00 PM and 3:00 PM PDT, we experienced increased error rates for new WorkSpaces provisioning in the US-WEST-2 Region. Existing WorkSpaces were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

9:16 PM PDT We're investigating increased error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region.
9:45 PM PDT Between 8:48 PM and 9:25 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated latencies and API Error Rates
archive.description:
2:25 AM PDT We are investigating elevated latencies and API error rates in the US-WEST-2 Region.
3:09 AM PDT We continue to investigate elevated latencies and API error rates in the US-WEST-2 Region.
8:04 AM PDT Between 2:04 AM and 7:50 AM PDT we experienced increased API error rates and latencies in the US-WEST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:01 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for Amazon S3 requests in the US-EAST-2 Region.
12:16 PM PDT We have identified the root cause of the increased error rates in the US-EAST-2 Region and are working towards resolution.
12:42 PM PDT We have identified the root cause and are seeing some recovery. We are continuing to monitor and work towards full resolution.
12:51 PM PDT Between 11:47 AM and 12:33 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for Amazon S3 requests in the US-EAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:35 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latency in the US-EAST-2 Region.
12:48 PM PDT Between 11:47 AM PDT and 12:33 PM PDT we experienced increased API error rates and latencies in the US-EAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:40 PM PDT We are investigating delays in S3 delivery for Kinesis Firehose in the US-EAST-2 Region.
1:01 PM PDT Between 11:47 AM and 12:38 PM PDT we experienced increased Firehose to S3 delivery delays in the US-EAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Degraded Volume Performance for EBS Volumes / Insufficient-Data for EC2 Instance Status Checks
archive.description: 12:57 PM PDT Between 11:47 AM and 12:33 PM PDT we experienced degraded performance for some EBS volumes in the US-EAST-2 Region. During this time, some customers also experienced insufficient-data in the results from EC2 instance status checks. CloudWatch alarms may have transitioned into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on the delayed metrics. EC2 instances operated normally during this time; only EC2 CloudWatch metrics were affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:00 PM PDT Between 11:47 AM PDT and 12:33 PM PDT we experienced an increased error rate for APIs and Git Push/Pull in the US-EAST-2 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:12 PM PDT Between 11:47 AM and 12:33 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates when launching Fargate tasks in the US-EAST-2 Region. Running tasks were not impacted. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:57 PM PDT We are currently investigating increased latencies and errors for the Agent Call Control Panel in the US-EAST-1 Region.
3:08 PM PDT Between 11:27 AM and 2:52 PM PDT, we experienced increased latencies and errors for the Agent Call Control Panel in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:01 AM PDT Between 5:31 AM and 6:42 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates for instance launches in a single availability zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:50 PM PDT We are investigating connectivity issues for some domains in the US-WEST-1 Region.
6:35 PM PDT Between 4:50 PM and 6:20 PM PDT we experienced domain connectivity issues in the US-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

current.description:
12:22 PM PDT We are investigating network connectivity issues for some instances within the US-EAST-1 Region.
12:30 PM PDT Between 11:27 AM and 11:28 AM PDT some instances experienced connectivity issues for network traffic between Availability Zones within the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue was automatically mitigated and we continue to monitor all affected instances.
1:06 PM PDT Between 11:27 AM and 11:28 AM PDT some instances experienced connectivity issues for network traffic between Availability Zones within the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:53 PM PDT We are investigating increased provisioning and back-end target registration times for load balancers within the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity to existing load balancers is not affected.

1:02 PM PDT Between 11:28 AM and 11:31 AM PDT some Multi-AZ and Single-AZ RDS instances experienced network connectivity issues in the US-EAST-1 Region. All affected Multi-AZ RDS instances failed over to a second Availability Zone, which restored connectivity. The majority of the Single-AZ RDS instances have recovered and we continue to work on restoring connectivity to a small number of remaining Single-AZ RDS instances.
1:28 PM PDT Between 11:28 AM and 11:31 AM PDT some Multi-AZ and Single-AZ RDS instances experienced network connectivity issues in the US-EAST-1 Region. All affected Multi-AZ RDS instances failed over to a second Availability Zone, which restored connectivity. The remaining Single-AZ RDS instances have now restored connectivity. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
2:02 PM PDT We are experiencing increased API error rates and delayed group scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity to existing EC2 Instances is not affected.
